document.title: English Language Proficiency Standards for K-12 Schools

382DC440DFE6013194E668A86D17958E.description: Identify an audience for writing in English

382D6840DFE6013194E568A86D17958E.description: Use tone and voice to engage specific audiences

382D0670DFE6013194E468A86D17958E.description: Identify questions for investigating a given topic

382CBDD0DFE6013194E368A86D17958E.description: Record or dictate knowledge of a topic in a variety of ways, such as by drawing pictures, making lists, or using graphic organizers to show connections among ideas

382C7540DFE6013194E268A86D17958E.description: Use multiple sources to extend writing

382C2A90DFE6013194E168A86D17958E.description: Narrate a sequence of events with some detail

382BD810DFE6013194E068A86D17958E.description: Write a brief narrative include elements of setting, character, and events

382B7230DFE6013194DF68A86D17958E.description: Write brief responses to selected literature with factual understanding of the text using simple sentences

382B2080DFE6013194DE68A86D17958E.description: Write in different forms for different purposes including lists to inform, letters to invite or thank, and stories to entertain

382AD2B0DFE6013194DD68A86D17958E.description: Write a short narrative story that includes elements of setting and character

382A83A0DFE6013194DC68A86D17958E.description: Write a few words or phrases about an event or character from a story read by the teacher

382A33F0DFE6013194DB68A86D17958E.description: List, label, or summarize content area information

3829E250DFE6013194DA68A86D17958E.description: Write to communicate basic personal information such as filling out forms, autobiographical sketches, home-culture descriptions

38298B10DFE6013194D968A86D17958E.description: Write basic information on classroom assignments, such as, name, date, class subject, teacher

38293D60DFE6013194D868A86D17958E.description: Use various types of writing for specific purposes

3828E7E0DFE6013194D768A86D17958E.description: Prewriting: Plan ideas through independent organizing activities such as listing, webbing, clustering, sequencing, and classifying in English

38288C70DFE6013194D668A86D17958E.description: Editing: Edit draft for basic grammatical constructions; expand use of adjectives and adverbs; check for singular and plural agreement

382822C0DFE6013194D568A86D17958E.description: Prewriting: Use graphic organizers as a prewriting activity to demonstrate prior knowledge, add information and prepare to write

3827D190DFE6013194D468A86D17958E.description: Editing: Edit writing for punctuation, capitalization and spelling with teacher assistance; create legible final copy

38278AB0DFE6013194D368A86D17958E.description: Prewriting: Generate ideas for writing by using prewriting techniques such as drawing and teacher assisted listing of key thoughts

38274380DFE6013194D268A86D17958E.description: Use the writing process to produce writing

3826FB60DFE6013194D168A86D17958E.description: Support a central idea with relevant details and examples

3826B140DFE6013194D068A86D17958E.description: Compose multiple sentences around a topic

38266170DFE6013194CF68A86D17958E.description: Compose simple declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences appropriate for language arts and other content areas based on a classroom model

38260A20DFE6013194CE68A86D17958E.description: Construct sentences and develop paragraphs to organize writing supporting a central idea

3825BCC0DFE6013194CD68A86D17958E.description: Use descriptive vocabulary to clarify details

382575E0DFE6013194CC68A86D17958E.description: Write using appropriate vocabulary choice and variation

38252F40DFE6013194CB68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate knowledge of negatives and contractions

3824E6C0DFE6013194CA68A86D17958E.description: Identify and correctly use subject verb agreement and past, present, and future tenses in writing simple sentences

38249AA0DFE6013194C968A86D17958E.description: Capitalize and punctuate correctly to clarify and enhance meaning (such as capitalizing titles, using possessives, commas in a series, apostrophes and contractions, and abbreviations)

38244690DFE6013194C868A86D17958E.description: Use basic grammatical constructions in simple sentences

3823FDF0DFE6013194C768A86D17958E.description: Use nouns (singulars and plurals), verbs (singular and plural), pronouns, adjectives, adverbs in writing

3823B3A0DFE6013194C668A86D17958E.description: Use capitalization and punctuation to begin and end sentences

38231CA0DFE6013194C468A86D17958E.description: Write simple sentences using key words available in the classroom environment

3822CAC0DFE6013194C368A86D17958E.description: Write the English alphabet legibly in cursive using upper and lower case

38227330DFE6013194C268A86D17958E.description: Write several sentences on a topic related to a visual prompt

382221F0DFE6013194C168A86D17958E.description: Copy from a model text with attention to using lines, margins, and spacing

3821CE60DFE6013194C068A86D17958E.description: Write words and short sentences from dictation with developmental spelling

38216D30DFE6013194BF68A86D17958E.description: Write labels, notes and captions for illustrations, charts, and objects

38211440DFE6013194BE68A86D17958E.description: Write personal information (name, address, phone number)

3820ABA0DFE6013194BD68A86D17958E.description: Use word and letter spacing to make messages readable

382034B0DFE6013194BC68A86D17958E.description: Write messages from left to right and top to bottom of the page

381FE670DFE6013194BB68A86D17958E.description: Write the English alphabet legibly in manuscript (printing) using upper and lower case

381F9AD0DFE6013194BA68A86D17958E.description: Use conventions and formats of written English

381EAC40DFE6013194B768A86D17958E.description: Understand literary forms by recognizing and distinguishing among stories, poems, and information books

381E13B0DFE6013194B568A86D17958E.description: Use graphic displays (photos, art, pictures, icons, symbols) and textual aides (sub-heading, graphs, charts) to understand stories and informational text

381DCA40DFE6013194B468A86D17958E.description: Recognize differences between expository and narrative text

381D7C70DFE6013194B368A86D17958E.description: Recognize format differences between poetry and prose

381D28E0DFE6013194B268A86D17958E.description: Identify elements of a story, including character, setting, and sequence of events

381CDE00DFE6013194B168A86D17958E.description: Analyze style and form of various genre

381C9810DFE6013194B068A86D17958E.description: Make and confirm predictions about the subject/story from text clues

381C4850DFE6013194AF68A86D17958E.description: Use pictures to make predictions about stories and informational text

381BEE00DFE6013194AE68A86D17958E.description: Use pictures/graphics to make predictions about text, and discuss conclusions

381B94C0DFE6013194AD68A86D17958E.description: Make inferences, predictions, and conclusions from reading

381AE420DFE6013194AB68A86D17958E.description: Read and follow sequential or multiple step written directions to complete tasks and assignments

381A8250DFE6013194AA68A86D17958E.description: Use simple reference materials (such as picture dictionaries) to acquire concepts

381A0B70DFE6013194A968A86D17958E.description: Read and follow simple written directions

3819A3F0DFE6013194A868A86D17958E.description: Use print from the environment to derive and reinforce meaning

38194DC0DFE6013194A768A86D17958E.description: Use prior background knowledge to approach text

3818AFE0DFE6013194A568A86D17958E.description: Apply reading skills in social and academic contexts

38186160DFE6013194A468A86D17958E.description: Participate in discussions describing characters, setting, events and plot

38180E30DFE6013194A368A86D17958E.description: Answer factual, simple questions about content of text

3817B440DFE6013194A268A86D17958E.description: Recognize the beginning, middle and end of narratives

38176010DFE6013194A168A86D17958E.description: Name characters and identify setting of story

38170130DFE6013194A068A86D17958E.description: Read and demonstrate comprehension of main idea and supporting details

381641F0DFE60131949E68A86D17958E.description: Identify simple literary terms (title, author, illustrator)

3815E870DFE60131949D68A86D17958E.description: Identify simple words with multiple meanings

381477B0DFE60131949968A86D17958E.description: Match oral words to printed words

38141390DFE60131949868A86D17958E.description: Use decoding skills to read known and unfamiliar words

3813C120DFE60131949768A86D17958E.description: Read common word families and rhyming words

38136390DFE60131949668A86D17958E.description: Use knowledge of consonants, consonant blends, and vowel sounds in decoding words

38130DA0DFE60131949568A86D17958E.description: Use knowledge of consonants and vowels sounds to match sounds to letters

38129BE0DFE60131949468A86D17958E.description: Understand that as letters change, so do sounds

38122310DFE60131949368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate that print represents spoken language

3811CB60DFE60131949268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate phonological awareness and the relationship of listening/speaking to decoding

381172D0DFE60131949168A86D17958E.description: Recognize capitalization and punctuation to convey meaning

38112120DFE60131949068A86D17958E.description: Use knowledge of simple spelling patterns when reading

3810D630DFE60131948F68A86D17958E.description: Understand that printed materials provide information

38108680DFE60131948E68A86D17958E.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book

38102280DFE60131948D68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that words have correct spelling

380FD5A0DFE60131948C68A86D17958E.description: Recognize that sentences in print are made up of separate words

380F84D0DFE60131948B68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate directionality by tracking print from left to right, and using return sweep

380EB8B0DFE60131948968A86D17958E.description: Know the difference between capital and lower case letters

380E56E0DFE60131948868A86D17958E.description: Know the order of the alphabet; name and identify each letter of the alphabet

380DFFF0DFE60131948768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate initial print awareness that print carries message

380D1880DFE60131948468A86D17958E.description: Summarize orally with accurate representation of the content of the conversation

380CC070DFE60131948368A86D17958E.description: Respond to messages by asking questions or by challenging statements

380C4F70DFE60131948268A86D17958E.description: Formulate and pose questions during classroom discussions

380BF3C0DFE60131948168A86D17958E.description: Make requests relevant to the teaching learning process (homework instructions)

380B5EF0DFE60131947F68A86D17958E.description: Use strategies to extend communicative competence

380B13C0DFE60131947E68A86D17958E.description: Retell stories and participate in short conversations

380AC530DFE60131947D68A86D17958E.description: Prepare and deliver short oral presentations

380A6FF0DFE60131947C68A86D17958E.description: Describe a concrete object or concept with prepared text

380A26A0DFE60131947B68A86D17958E.description: Present information, concepts, and ideas to an audience of listeners on a variety of topics

3809DB70DFE60131947A68A86D17958E.description: Speak clearly and comprehensibly by using standard English grammatical forms, pronunciation, phrasing and intonation

380989D0DFE60131947968A86D17958E.description: Speak understandably with awareness of English intonation and phonological patterns

38093960DFE60131947868A86D17958E.description: Use clearly spoken single words and learned phrases to be understood by a native speaker

3808E8F0DFE60131947768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate comprehensible pronunciation and intonation for clarity in oral communication

380895F0DFE60131947668A86D17958E.description: Talk about experiences using expanded vocabulary, descriptive words and paraphrasing

38084E20DFE60131947568A86D17958E.description: Respond to messages by asking questions, challenging statements, or offering examples that affirm the message

38080540DFE60131947468A86D17958E.description: Answer instructional questions with supporting details

3807B980DFE60131947368A86D17958E.description: Answer instructional questions by using simple sentences

380769E0DFE60131947268A86D17958E.description: Provide and obtain information; express and exchange opinions

38071B50DFE60131947168A86D17958E.description: Participate actively in content area discussions with peers and teachers

3806C760DFE60131947068A86D17958E.description: Participate actively in cooperative group activities and projects

3805E5E0DFE60131946D68A86D17958E.description: Give directions or instructions to classmates

38059460DFE60131946C68A86D17958E.description: Ask and answer instructional questions using simple sentences

38053AA0DFE60131946B68A86D17958E.description: Restate in basic terms the main idea of oral presentations using subject area content

380480D0DFE60131946968A86D17958E.description: Ask and respond to questions using phrases or simple sentences

3803CA10DFE60131946768A86D17958E.description: Recite rhymes, songs and simple stories

38035A40DFE60131946668A86D17958E.description: Use English to interact in the classroom

3802F590DFE60131946568A86D17958E.description: Recognize some gestures, facial expressions and body language

3802AA30DFE60131946468A86D17958E.description: Maintain eye contact when communicating in person

38025DE0DFE60131946368A86D17958E.description: Use spoken English and nonverbal communication in socially and culturally appropriate ways

38021170DFE60131946268A86D17958E.description: Participate in social conversations with peers and adults on unfamiliar topics by asking and answering questions and restating and requesting information

3801C3C0DFE60131946168A86D17958E.description: Participate in social conversations with peers and adults on familiar topics by asking and answering questions and requesting information

38017570DFE60131946068A86D17958E.description: Use common social greetings and simple repetitive phrases

38011E90DFE60131945F68A86D17958E.description: Communicate basic wants and needs in English

3800D0D0DFE60131945E68A86D17958E.description: Engage in conversations for personal expression and enjoyment

38007FE0DFE60131945D68A86D17958E.description: Acquire goods, services, or information by spoken request

38001870DFE60131945C68A86D17958E.description: Participate in conversations on social topics by asking and requesting information

37FFBFB0DFE60131945B68A86D17958E.description: Make requests and obtain information from the community

37FF55E0DFE60131945A68A86D17958E.description: Use learned phrases to respond to questions and directions

37FEFC90DFE60131945968A86D17958E.description: Use spoken language for daily activities within and beyond the school setting

37FDE8B0DFE60131945668A86D17958E.description: Respond to the implications of tones of voice

37FD3960DFE60131945468A86D17958E.description: Listen critically to interpret and evaluate

37FCED20DFE60131945368A86D17958E.description: Use age-appropriate social conventions that characterize the new culture while listening, such as eye contact, physical proximity, and turn-taking

37FCA4F0DFE60131945268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate understanding of speaker's feelings and attitudes toward a topic

37FC5920DFE60131945168A86D17958E.description: Identify speaker attitude and point of view

37FC0870DFE60131945068A86D17958E.description: Understand vocabulary and discourse features of content areas

37FBA850DFE60131944F68A86D17958E.description: Understand key content area vocabulary supported by visuals and written text provided during classroom instruction

37FB5560DFE60131944E68A86D17958E.description: Understand limited key content area vocabulary supported by visual representations and realia (real-life objects)

37FB06D0DFE60131944D68A86D17958E.description: Identify meaning of vocabulary in the content areas

37FAB4F0DFE60131944C68A86D17958E.description: Listen attentively to stories/information and identify key details and concepts using both verbal and non-verbal responses

37FA4A30DFE60131944B68A86D17958E.description: Orally identify main points of simple conversations and stories read aloud

37F9E7D0DFE60131944A68A86D17958E.description: Listen and respond to stories and other texts read aloud, including classic and contemporary works

37F99200DFE60131944968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate comprehension of oral presentations and instructions through nonverbal responses

37F94530DFE60131944868A86D17958E.description: Listen attentively to stories and information read aloud

37F8F6A0DFE60131944768A86D17958E.description: Use active listening comprehension in a variety of situations such as following directions, responding to requests, and listening for specific purposes

37F89F90DFE60131944668A86D17958E.description: Identify main ideas and supporting details from spoken English

37F7C700DFE60131944468A86D17958E.description: Understand age-appropriate social discourse with occasional repetition and rephrasing

37F77A20DFE60131944368A86D17958E.description: Understand simple speech produced by peers and adults on familiar topics with repetition and rephrasing

37F72960DFE60131944268A86D17958E.description: Understand basic language such as, greetings, leave-taking, questions, and directions

37F6D370DFE60131944168A86D17958E.description: Understand highly contextualized simple speech with frequent repetition and rephrasing

37F68050DFE60131944068A86D17958E.description: Understand spoken English to participate in social contexts

37F638E0DFE60131943F68A86D17958E.description: Clarify classroom assignments with teacher and/or peers

37F5F090DFE60131943E68A86D17958E.description: Perform most uncomplicated classroom tasks when prompted

37F5A740DFE60131943D68A86D17958E.description: Respond appropriately and courteously to directions and questions

37F55A80DFE60131943C68A86D17958E.description: Follow simple three or four-step oral directions to complete a classroom task

37F4F260DFE60131943B68A86D17958E.description: Perform basic classroom tasks when prompted

37F48B60DFE60131943A68A86D17958E.description: Interpret gestures and visual cues used in instruction

37F435E0DFE60131943968A86D17958E.description: Follow simple two-step oral directions to complete a task in English

37F3DD00DFE60131943868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate understanding through non-verbal gestures or with single words or learned phrases
